task.title: How to Make Lactose-Free Ice Cream with Machine
task.shortdesc: How to make lactose-free ice cream with soy milk, soy creamer, and vegan chocolate

taskbody.prereq:
The following steps will help you make soy ice cream.
Goal: Make dairy-free ice cream with soy for those that are lactose-intolerant
Audience: Student or faculty in Shanks
Materials: Machine, moist cloth, two cups soy milk, two cups soy creamer, two tablespoons of cornstarch, one-half cup honey, vegan chocolate, spatula
Do not fill the freezer bowl higher than one-half inch from the top. The ingredients will increase in volume during the freezing process, and this machine yields two quarts or less of whatever is made.
The machine will stop if the system overheats. The machine may overheat if the dessert being prepared is extremely thick, if the unit has been running for an excessively long time, or if the added ingredients contain large pieces.

step.cmd: Wipe motor base with moist cloth
Move easy-lock lid with ingredient spout over the freezer bowl until it locks into place

substep.cmd: Attach cap wit measurement cup oer easy-lock lid
Press "Start/Stop." The freezer bowl will start churning.

step.cmd: Pour soy milk and creamer athrough the cap with measurement cup (see Figure 4 below)
step.info: Figure 4: Examples of Soy Milk and Soy Creamer

step.cmd: Add in honey, cornstarch, and vegan chocolate

substep.cmd: Nutella is dense and can be tricky to move and scoop. Be hasty during this part because the ingredients need to mix together as soon as possible.
Frozen dessert will take 15 to 40 minutes to complete. When the mixture has thickened to your liking, it is done.
After 40 minutes, the machine will beep for five seconds every three minutes for a maximum of 30 minutes to signal that the process is complete.

step.cmd: Open cap and twist off easy-lock lid
Take out ice cream from bowl using spatula
